description: IT giant Cognizant is reportedly training executives on ProHance, a tool that monitors employee laptop activity and application usage for micro-level productivity tracking. The system records mouse and keyboard input to gauge engagement, marking employees as 'idle' or 'away from system' after specific inactivity periods. While Cognizant states the data won't impact individual performance reviews, focusing instead on project efficiency and client demands for billable hours, employee concerns about micromanagement persist.

National Green Tribunal pulls up Himachal govt over Kullu waste crisis

description: A celebration of the legendary sitarist’s legacy will bring together acclaimed artistes and also honour Dr P Sriram with its first Lifetime Achievement Award

title: ‘Abhishek Nayar is the straight answer for Andre Russell’s release:’ Former India batter criticises KKR’s IPL 2026 decision
Delhi court sends Red Fort blast accused to 10-day NIA custody
description: The accused, Amir Rashid Ali, was produced before the Principal District and Sessions judge

title: 'Have faith in Shami': Ganguly's message to Gambhir after Eden shocker
description: Following India's Test defeat to South Africa, Sourav Ganguly reiterated his call for Mohammed Shami's Test comeback, emphasising the need to trust proven pacers like Bumrah, Siraj, and Shami. Ganguly also urged coach Gautam Gambhir to prepare better wickets, stating Team India needs solid batting foundations to win Test matches.

title: Nitish Kumar resigns as Bihar CM: Oath ceremony on Nov 20
description: Nitish Kumar resigned as Bihar chief minister, paving the way for his 10th term. The NDA government, securing a strong majority in the recent elections, will see Kumar sworn in on Thursday, November 20. The new cabinet will include JD(U), BJP, and smaller allies, with seat allocations finalized.

title: Bangladesh’s ousted PM Sheikh Hasina, ex-Home Minister sentenced to death; security on high alert
description: A Bangladesh court convicted former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina of crimes against humanity for a 2024 crackdown, raising concerns over political unrest ahead of upcoming elections

title: India inks ‘historic first’ deal to source around 10% of its LPG imports from US in 2026
Manoj Bajpayee says Amitabh Bachchan almost killed him: He gave me a heart attack at 85 feet, said, ‘Tell Jaya if something happens’
Red Fort blast: Two men picked up from Nuh, police say Umar stayed at one of their homes for 10 days
Inflation at record low! Will your loan EMIs come down further? Explained
description: Retail inflation in October has hit its lowest level since 2013 - the time that this series of CPI inflation started. At the start of 2025, the repo rate stood at 6.5% - and as the end of the year approaches, it has come down by a full 100 basis points! Where will the easing cycle stop? Will RBI wait for more clarity on the India-US trade deal, or is time ripe for another rate cut?

title: 'If Pak gives us an opportunity …': Army chief’s warning after Delhi blast; calls Op Sindoor a 'trailer'
description: Army chief has issued a stern warning to Pakistan and terror groups, stating that the recent Operation Sindoor was merely a preview of India's capabilities. He emphasized that India will retaliate against both terrorists and their state sponsors, asserting that the nation is prepared for future challenges and will not be intimidated.

title: Supreme Court judgment makes Uttarakhand liable to restore, repair Corbett Tiger Reserve
description: Supreme Court orders Uttarakhand to restore the Corbett Tiger Reserve after illegal tree-felling, mandating demolition of unauthorised structures and a restoration plan within months

title: Delhi Police summons Al-Falah University chairman in terror module, fake documents probes
description: “Both regulatory bodies flagged 'major irregularities' after reviewing the University's accreditation claims and submitted their findings to law enforcement agencies,” says Officials

title: Al-Falah University and the cracks in India’s accreditation system
description: A terror investigation into the 10 November Red Fort blast has unexpectedly exposed major flaws in India’s accreditation system. As Al-Falah University came under scrutiny, NAAC, AIU and Delhi Police simultaneously flagged alleged fake accreditation claims, triggering notices, suspensions and FIRs. The episode reveals how easily institutions can project legitimacy—and how slowly regulators act until a crisis forces intervention.

title: X Corp challenges legality of ‘Sahyog’ portal takedown process before Karnataka HC
description: X argued that Section 79 of the Information Technology Act, 2000, is merely a 'safe harbour' clause shielding intermediaries from liability and does not empower the government to direct content blocking.

title: Death toll in stone quarry collapse in Uttar Pradesh climbs to six
description: "One body was recovered in the night. The deceased was identified as Indrajit (30), a resident of Panari, Obra. The other two bodies have not been identified and efforts are on to identify them," says District Magistrate

title: Is Pakistan bringing nuclear blackmail back to the table?
Kumar Sangakkara reappointed as Rajasthan Royals' head coach
description: Dravid had left the franchise in August this year and Sangakkara, who has been the franchise's Director of Cricket since 2021, will be returning as the head coach having served in the same role from 2021-2024

title: Mumbai CNG pumps see rush after gas pipeline damage disrupts supply
description: In a statement, MGL said the disruption occurred owing to third-party damage to GAIL's main gas supply pipeline inside the RCF compound

description: The launch will bring the distinctive Nothing experience to more users with unmistakable style and innovation at an accessible price, said Nothing

description: Project will be developed on a 20-acre industrial site within an electronics manufacturing cluster; investment expected to create 200 direct jobs and over 300 indirect jobs

title: 'We are not the best players of spin': R Ashwin slams India's Eden collapse
description: Ravichandran Ashwin criticises India's batting collapse against South Africa, stating the current generation struggles against spin. He believes past Indian batters would have handled the turning track better, attributing the decline to insufficient practice. Ashwin argues Western teams now outperform India against spin due to dedicated preparation, a stark contrast to India's improved overseas pace bowling.

title: Saudi Arabia Bus Crash Live Updates: At least 45 Indian pilgrims dead near Medina, Hyderabad families in distress
‘Perks of living in India’: Italian woman praises Bengaluru’s safety after finding helmet exactly where she left it
TMC heavyweight, face of Bengal ‘defection politics’, disqualified as MLA: Who is Mukul Roy
Mecca–Medina tragedy: Govt releases list of 45 passengers; Hyderabad families await updates
description: A tragic road accident in Saudi Arabia has claimed the lives of over 40 Indian Umrah pilgrims, all reportedly from Hyderabad. A passenger bus carrying pilgrims from Mecca to Medina collided with a diesel tanker, with many victims believed to have been asleep at the time. Authorities are working to identify all deceased and provide assistance to affected families.

title: Is Perplexity most at risk if AI bubble pops? Here’s why a Silicon Valley crowd thinks so

Local body elections: Issue of alliances to become clear after nominations end, say Fadnavis
'Starmer out': Thousands protest over govt plan to house asylum seekers
description: Around 2,000 people protested in Crowborough against plans to house 540 single male asylum seekers at a disused army camp. Concerns over safety, local services, and an "information vacuum" fueled community tension, with some residents installing panic alarms. The Home Office stated security checks and behavioral expectations will be enforced.

India seals first LPG pact with US; 2.2 MTPA deal to meet 10% of total import needs
description: India has finalized its first one-year structured agreement to import approximately 2.2 million tonnes per annum of LPG from the US Gulf Coast. This historic deal, set for 2026, diversifies India's energy supply chain and marks a significant step in securing stable and affordable LPG for households, including Ujjwala beneficiaries.

title: Will gold be under pressure in the coming days? Why Rs 1,22,000 is an important level
description: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to face pressure this week due to global factors, including shifting Federal Reserve rate cut expectations and weak US economic indicators. While some data initially supported bullion, a firmer dollar and subdued Asian demand are likely to weigh on prices.

title: Explained | Amid poor guardrails, global crypto market stood at $2.6 bn in 2024, could grow to $15 bn by 2035
The Coin Laundry | Regulatory haze: Bank services, govt taxes, but no governing law
How interstellar objects reach Earth and where they are most likely to land
description: New simulations reveal interstellar objects don't arrive uniformly, with concentrations from the solar apex and galactic plane. Earth's orbital motion creates seasonal impact patterns, peaking in Northern Hemisphere winter. Most impacts are predicted near the equator, with a slight Northern Hemisphere bias due to orbital geometry and the Sun's influence.

description: Rajasthan Royals have appointed Kumar Sangakkara as their head coach for IPL 2026, alongside his Director of Cricket role. This move follows a disappointing 2025 season under Rahul Dravid. Sangakkara, who previously led the team to the 2022 final, aims to bring stability and renewed competitiveness with a strengthened coaching staff.

Mecca-Medina bus crash: Control room set up in Jeddah - here are the helpline numbers
description: A tragic bus accident near Medina, Saudi Arabia, claimed the lives of 42 Indian Umrah pilgrims, many believed to be from Hyderabad. The bus collided with a diesel tanker while traveling from Mecca. Indian authorities have released emergency helpline numbers and established control rooms to assist affected families.

title: IND vs SA—'Defence becomes last priority': Ex-India cricketer's blunt warning
description: India's recent Test defeat to South Africa highlights a decline in defensive batting, according to former batter Sanjay Manjrekar. He believes the dominance of T20s and leagues has made Test cricket the least favoured format, diminishing players' ability to block out quality spells. Manjrekar suggests a shift in pitch philosophy, advocating for English-style pitches to revive competitive Test cricket.

title: Why Rhesus Monkeys need protection – ‘They play key role in dynamics of nature’
5-year-old boy falls to death from 22nd-floor in Gurgaon
description: A tragic incident unfolded in Gurgaon's Sector 62 where a five-year-old boy, Rudra Tej Singh, fell to his death from the 22nd floor of Pioneer Presidia Society. While returning with his nanny, the boy inadvertently locked himself out of their apartment. He then climbed onto a clothes rack on the balcony seeking help, but lost his balance and fell.

title: Delhi Belly and Pyaar Ka Punchnama defined 2011 in the year of Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara, Singham and Ra.One
As America tightens H1B curbs, are Indians losing out or finally gaining an edge?
description: As the US tightens H-1B visa rules and raises costs sharply, the long-assumed arc of Indian engineering ambition is being challenged. Yet early signals from IIT campuses and industry suggest a surprising shift: instead of anxiety, India’s talent pool is turning inward with new confidence, driven by booming GCCs, rising startups, and a sense that opportunity no longer requires a Westward leap.

Trump warns countries trading with Russia on oil; backs 500% tariff
description: US President Donald Trump supports new sanctions targeting Russia. Countries trading with Moscow could face severe penalties. Iran may also be included. Senators are proposing even stronger measures, including tariffs on oil purchases. These actions aim to pressure nations supporting Russia's actions in Ukraine. The goal is to isolate Russia economically and end the conflict.

Delhi records best November 1–15 air quality in 3 years — still not worth inhaling
description: Delhi experienced its lowest average AQI in three years during the first fortnight of November, registering at 348. This improvement, despite remaining in the 'very poor' category, is attributed to an early Diwali, reduced stubble burning, better weather, and water sprinkling near monitoring stations.

40 years ago November 17, 1985: Indo-Pak trade deals
A new cafe in Bastar will bring ex-Maoists and victims of Naxal violence together
Lalu pari-war: After Rohini, 3 more daughters walk out of Patna home
description: A bitter family feud has erupted within Lalu Prasad's family, with daughter Rohini Acharya alleging humiliation and abuse from her brother Tejashwi Yadav and his associates after donating a kidney to her father. The fallout intensified as three more sisters left their parents' home, while Tej Pratap Yadav voiced support for Rohini, accusing 'betrayers' of targeting the family.

title: ‘Hubby’s innocent’: Blood-written message on floor was UP man’s last bluff after killing wife
description: In a shocking twist in Prayagraj, a husband attempted to mask his wife's murder as a suicide. He penned a fabricated confession using her blood, but investigators quickly spotted the red flags—there simply wasn't enough blood for the message.

title: French consulate staffer molested while walking home in Bandra
description: A 27-year-old French individual became the victim of an alarming molestation incident by a scooter rider on the streets of Bandra West. On November 8th, the unfortunate event spurred a police investigation that culminated in the arrest of 25-year-old Sunil Waghela, a trader from Dharavi.

title: Who is Rameez Nemat Khan? 'Outsider' behind Lalu family’s turmoil; ex-cricketer faces 12 criminal cases
description: RJD chief Lalu Prasad's daughter Rohini Acharya blamed "outsiders" for the party's electoral defeat, pointing to former cricketer Rameez Nemat Khan and RJD MP Sanjay Yadav. Khan, son-in-law of jailed politician Rizwan Zaheer, faces multiple criminal cases, including murder and Gangsters Act charges, despite being granted bail in several instances.

title: 'Bihar approves Gobi farming': Assam min’s post sparks row for ‘alluding to 1989 Bhagalpur riots’
description: Assam minister Ashok Singhal's post on "gobi farming" after Bihar poll results has sparked outrage from the Congress. The opposition alleges the imagery alludes to the 1989 Bhagalpur violence, where victims were reportedly hidden under cauliflower plantations. Congress leaders condemned the remark as "vulgar and shameful."

title: NHL Injury Update: Charlie McAvoy out after slapshot in the Montreal Canadiens
description: Boston Bruins star defenseman Charlie McAvoy suffered a facial injury after a slapshot during Saturday's game. He was seen being helped off the ice and is currently undergoing tests. His return for upcoming games remains uncertain, causing concern for fans and the team. Updates on his condition are eagerly awaited.

title: Bihar results: Almost equal vote share for Owaisi’s AIMIM and NOTA
description: In Bihar's recent assembly elections, Asaduddin Owaisi's AIMIM and NOTA secured nearly identical vote shares, polling 1.85% and 1.81% respectively. Experts suggest this parity reflects voter disenchantment with mainstream parties, while the decline of traditional parties like CPI also warrants closer examination.

title: India needs 86 million higher education enrolments by 2035 to meet NEP goals: Report
description: India’s higher education sector faces an unprecedented expansion push, with a new report warning that achieving the NEP 2020 goal of a 50 percent GER will require 86.11 million enrolments by 2035. As traditional campuses strain under capacity and skill demands shift rapidly, the report urges digital ecosystems, flexible learning, and quality-focused reforms to prevent India’s demographic advantage from eroding.

title: How to send WhatsApp messages without saving a contact on your phone
description: WhatsApp allows users to initiate chats without saving contacts by using Click to Chat links or the official "Chat on WhatsApp" button. This feature streamlines communication for temporary interactions and business inquiries, offering flexibility on both mobile and web platforms. Users can create custom links with pre-filled messages for added convenience.
